Fales Library and Special Collections
Arvid Paulson Papers
Paulson, Arvid
MSS.043
8.5 Linear Feet (21 boxes)
1875-1977 The Arvid Paulson Papers represent Paulson's attempts to bring the work of August Strindberg and Henrik Ibsen to a twentieth century American public. The collection contains his correspondence with actors, publishers and producers, the manuscripts of his translations, some of his published criticism on Strindberg and Ibsen as well as that of other authors. Finally, it contains miscellaneous theatre memorabilia culled from a long life spent going to the theatre, perfoming in plays and occasionally even producing them himself.
Provenance
Arvid Paulson donated his collection of rare and first editions of August Strindberg's writings to the Fales Library in 1970. His papers, consisting of eight linear feet of correspondence, manuscripts, printed material and memorabilia, were given over a period of years from 1970 until his death in Malmo, Sweden, in 1977.
Access Restrictions
Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
Biography of Arvid Paulson
Arvid Paulson (1888-1977) was an author, translator and actor. Born in Helsingborg, Sweden, he emigrated to the United States in 1904. Though he performed in many plays written by Strindberg and Ibsen, he is perhaps best known as a translator of their work.
Scope and Content Note
Series I: Correspondence contains Paulson's correspondence with various producers, actors and publishers, 1917-1977.
Series II: Manuscripts contains the manuscripts for Paulson's translations of Ibsen, Strindberg and other Scandinavian writers; it also contains Paulson's collection of Ibsen ephemera.
Series III: Publications contains Paulson's and other writers' published articles about Strindberg.
Series IV: Printed Matter and Memorabilia contains programs, playbills, photographs and miscellaneous other material relating to productions of Strindberg's and Ibsen's plays in Sweden and America, as well as more generally to the twentieth century American theatre.
Series V: Paulson contains some of Paulson's personal papers.
Arrangement
The collection has been organized into five Series. Each series initiates a new numbering sequence. Oversize material is listed toward the end of the collection.
Missing Title
Series I: Correspondence
Series II: Manuscripts
Series III: Publications
Series IV: Printed Matter and Memorabilia
Series V: Paulson's Personal Papers
Oversize
Separated Material
In addition to the material found here, Arvid Paulson also donated some 350 books and articles by and about Strindberg and Henrik Ibsen to the Fales Library. The following books and articles have been separated from the collection and are individually catalogued through BobCat.

Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Arvid Paulson Papers; MSS 043; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

Series I: Correspondence
Scope and Contents note
Correspondence between Paulson and various directors, producers, actors, and publishers, 1916-1974.Correspondence to various people from Paulson, re: Harriet Bosse1955-195811Correspondence to various people from Paulson, re: publishing and the theatre1916-196812Correspondence between Paulson and Ben-Ali Bobker, re: The 1952 Pasadena Playhouse production of Strindberg's "The Great Highway"195213Correspondence between Paulson and Dudley Nichols, re: movie productions of Strindberg's plays1952-195514Correspondence from various actors and writers1920-196815Correspondence from various people1912-192516Correspondence from various people1926-193617Correspondence from various people1938-195218Correspondence from various people1954-196519Correspondence from various people1966-1974110Correspondence: Christmas Cardsn.d.111Correspondence from various peoplen.d.112Correspondence from various peoplen.d.113Correspondence from Paulson, re: Strindberg Society, Strindberg statue, etc.1923-1974114Series II: Manuscripts
Scope and Contents note
Series II contains the mss. of Paulson's translations of Henrik Ibsen, August Strindberg and other Scandinavian authors. Subseries A contains Paulson's translations of Ibsen, as well as miscellaneous Ibsen ephemera collected by Paulson; the ephemera includes playbills, postcards and criticism. Series II, Subseries B contains Paulson's mss. translations of Strindberg; subseries C contains the same material, this time in drafts prepared for publication. Subseries D contains Paulson's translations of Vilhelm Moberg, Knut Hamsun, Gustav Geijerstam and other Scandinavian authors. Subseries E contains miscellaneous manuscripts.Subseries A: Henrik IbsenBrand: The Shrieve. Trans. Miles M. Dawsonn.d.21Bergwitz, Jon K. Introduction to Strindberg1520Charles XII1521Unidentified mss., fragments1522Series III: Publications
Scope and Contents note
Series III contains criticism and translations published by Paulson and other writers in Swedish and American periodicals. Subseries A contains Paulson's articles on Strindberg, as well as Paulson's translations of Strindberg, Selma Lagerlof and Arvid Skappel. Subseries B contains articles on Strindberg and on Strindberg studies by other authors, as well as a 1913 translation of Strindberg's "Half a Sheet of Paper.Subseries A: Paulson's published criticism"On Translating Strindberg." The Tulane Drama Review 4:319601818World Theatre: Special Strindberg Issue 11:119621819Misc. Articles on Strindberg1820Series IV: Printed Matter and Memorabilia
Scope and Contents note
Series IV contains playbills, photographs, tickets, press clippings and other material from Paulson's life as a producer, performer and theater-goer; in addition it contains publicity material for his books and misc. Strindberg memorabilia. Subseries A contains playbills, photographs and tickets from performances of Strindberg's plays in Sweden and America, 1918-1979; Paulson either acted in or supplied the translations for some of these productions. Subseries A also contains misc. material from Paulson's life in the theatre, such as a 1941 manual for theatre staff and an assortment of actors' periodicals. Subseries B contains Strindberg memorabilia.Subseries A: Playbills, photographs, tickets, periodicals, misc.Playbills: Strindberg1918-1933191Playbills: Strindberg1942-1949192Playbills: Strindberg1952-1958193Playbills: Strindberg1962-1969194Playbills: Strindberg1970s195Playbills: Paulson's own performances in Strindberg's plays; performances based on Paulson's translations1915-1970196Press clippings: Strindberg's "The Great Highway"1949/1952197Photographs: Strindberg's "The Great Highway" (set design)1949198Photographs: Strindberg's "The Great Highway" (performance)1952199Photographs: Strindberg's "Brott och Brott" (set design)19511910Photographs: Strindberg's "Miss Julie" (performance)1951/19581911Photographs: Strindberg's "Stormclouds" (performance)n.d.1912Photographs: misc.
